lines.text: [last lines]

[Superman has dropped Luthor off at prison and they are discussing nuclear weapons]
Is the world gonna be vaporized?
No. It's the same as it's always been, Luthor. On the brink. With good fighting evil. See you in twenty.
[Superman flies off]
Madam Chairman, I don't represent any one particular country, but I'd like to address the delegates.
Well... in that case, you will need a sponsor.
[all delegates raise their hands]
I believe that will do. Please.
This is my nephew Lenny. He worships me.
[Superman and Nuclear Man confront each other in downtown Metropolis]
Where is the woman?
Give it up, you'll never find her.
If you will not tell me, I will hurt people!
[Nuclear Man begins to cause mass destruction]
Stop! Don't do it, the people!
Lenny, let's try and keep your IQ a family secret.
You'd risk world wide nuclear war for your own personal financial gain.
Nobody wants war. I just want to keep the threat alive.
You know what I can do with a single strand of Superman's hair?
You can make a toupee that flies.
Just remember, I made you.
Yeah, you're just an experiment, freako!
[Nuclear Man raises his hand and lifts Lenny up into the air]

[Makes Lenny spin around]
I am an experiment? I am a freako?
[Sets Lenny down]
I made you and I can destroy you.
Destroy. Destroy Superman now!

And there will be peace. There will be peace when the people of the world, want it so badly, that their governments will have no choice but to give it to them. I just wish you could all see the Earth the way that I see it. Because when you really look at it, it's just one world.
You gotta go with your gut.
Destroy Superman!
First, I have fun.
Uh... no pain, no gain?

I'd want to tell him that I cherished the time we spent together, and I never expected anything from him. Even if I only saw him for a few moments, it made me happy. And I'd want to tell him that I love him and that I'll always love him. And... no matter what happens on this world, I know he tried his best to help us.
You can't park here! You'll get towed! Lois, do you have any idea how much a ticket's gonna cost here?
Lacy, it's only money!
[Superman is addressing the UN]
What's he gonna say?
Something wonderful.
You gonna skip the country, Uncle Lex?
Destroy Superman!

[touches Nuclear Man]
Oh, no! He's like... He's, like, cold.
He gets his energy from the sun. Without it, he's like you at night - useless.
"If you didn't buy it from Jean-Pierre, you didn't buy it on ze black market."
Destroy Superman.
Later.

[to Superman]
He's a little bit anxious. Can you blame him?

[to Superman]
Goodnight, sweet prince. Parting is... inevitable.
[first lines]

[in Russian]
You can sing later comrade Sinatra.

[in Russian]
Back at home they told me to sing in space.

[returns Cosmonaut to capsule, speaks in Russian]
You'll be safer singing in here.

[to Clark]
You never could hit a curve ball!
You know what this means, Uncle Lex?
What?
We're gonna be parents!

[introduces Nuclear Man to Superman]
Look closely at the cell structure. You see anything familiar?

You've broken all the laws of man, Luthor. Not it looks as though you've broken all the laws of nature, too. I can only assume you must have hidden a device of some kind on one of the missiles I hurled into the sun.
You know, Mr. Muscle, I'm really gonna miss these little chats we had together. You're the only one that could keep up with me.

[to Lenny]
Now Leonard, your Uncle Lex, with this protoplasm that I've grown from Superman's hair cells... will duplicate creation itself!
I know I'm forbidden to interfere... and yet the Earth is threatened by the same fate as Krypton's.
The Earth is too primitive. You can flee to new worlds, where war is long forgotten.
If you teach the Earth to put its fate in any one man, even yourself, you're teaching them to be betrayed.
Betrayed! Betrayed! Betrayed! Betrayed!

[When Nuclear man levitates Lenny and sets him spinning]
Hey I was just kidding about the Freako before, if anyone's a freako around here, it's gotta be me.
[Superman has flown into Lex Luthor's Lair]
The Dude of Steel! Boy are you gonna get it!
Lenny, I've always considered you the Dutch Elm disease in my family tree.
